document.heading: District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982 Amendments Act of 1985

history.narrative: Law 6-35, the “District of Columbia Public Assistance Act of 1982 Amendments Act of 1985,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-97, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 28, 1985, and June 11, 1985, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 14, 1985, it was assigned Act No. 6-50 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
